title: [ppc64le pytorch] Error with building sleef when using cmake 3.11.1 (cmake 3.9.4 works)
body_html:
Error when doing python setup.py install:

-- COMPILER_SUPPORTS_OPENMP : 1
-- A version of SLEEF compatible with libm and libmvec in GNU libc will be produced (sleefgnuabi.so)
disable contrib because ATEN_NO_CONTRIB is set
-- Configuring done
CMake Error at /home/jenkins/pytorch/third_party/sleef/src/libm/CMakeLists.txt:363 (add_library):
No SOURCES given to target: sleefgnuabi

Going back to cmake 3.9.4 works

Collecting environment information...
PyTorch version: 0.5.0a0+331a04d
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.0.176

OS: Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu/IBM 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.9) 5.4.0 20160609
CMake version: version 3.9.4

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 9.0.176
GPU models and configuration:
GPU 0: Tesla P100-SXM2-16GB
GPU 1: Tesla P100-SXM2-16GB

Nvidia driver version: 384.81
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/lib/powerpc64le-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.0.3
/usr/lib/powerpc64le-linux-gnu/libcudnn_static_v7.a

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] numpy (1.14.3)
[pip] torch (0.5.0a0+331a04d)
[conda] torch 0.5.0a0+331a04d

Error when doing  python setup.py install:

-- COMPILER_SUPPORTS_OPENMP : 1
-- A version of SLEEF compatible  with libm and libmvec in GNU libc will be produced (sleefgnuabi.so)
disable contrib because ATEN_NO_CONTRIB is set
-- Configuring done
CMake Error at /home/jenkins/pytorch/third_party/sleef/src/libm/CMakeLists.txt:363 (add_library):
  No SOURCES given to target: sleefgnuabi

Going back to cmake 3.9.4  works
